CatDescriptText: Mrs. Betty Benedetti, housewife, West End, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should push for non-segregated cemeteries, or should they sponsor their own?"  Answer reads: "They should get into the white cemeteries. After you are dead, what difference does it make?"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Betty Benedetti wearing dark coat with top button unfastened, and dark shirt, posed in front of sign reading "...tch long..."
